hints.label: thm-complete-boundary-drift
hints.title: Complete Boundary Potential Drift Characterization
hints.content:
7735: :label: thm-complete-boundary-drift
7736: 
7737: The cloning operator $\Psi_{\text{clone}}$ induces the following drift on the boundary potential:
7738: 
7739: $$
7740: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta W_b] \leq -\kappa_b W_b + C_b
7741: $$
7742: 
7743: where:
7744: - $\kappa_b = p_{\text{boundary}}(\phi_{\text{thresh}}) > 0$ is the minimum cloning probability for boundary-exposed walkers
7745: - $C_b = O(\sigma_x^2 + N^{-1})$ accounts for position jitter and dead walker revival
7746: - Both constants are **$N$-independent** in the large-$N$ limit
7747: 
7748: **Key Properties:**
7749: 
7750: 1. **Unconditional contraction:** The drift is negative for all states with $W_b > C_b/\kappa_b$
7751: 
7752: 2. **Strengthening near danger:** The contraction rate $\kappa_b$ increases with boundary proximity (through $\phi_{\text{thresh}}$)
